TopicTitle: The kraken haunts the seas (weird ocean behaviour)

Articles.Content:
Here is a craft that I'd build just days prior in KSP1 (and recreated here) launched from the boat launch station. I don't know what other people's experiences with building boats/seaplanes have been so far but after spending most of last night trying to build a working seaplane I can say that the oceans are definitely kraken-infested.

It also has me suspect that Physics Easing might not be a thing yet.

Water is unpredictable. My one attempt at a jet powered boat ended up with it spinning out of control, sinking and crashing at the bottom.

Ironic considering my topic here

5 minutes ago, The Aziz said:

 My one attempt at a jet powered boat ended up with it spinning out of control, sinking and crashing at the bottom.

That was another issue I ran into. Sinking seems to be a lot easier in KSP2 than KSP1.

Yep. Already took a look at hydrodynamics and wow. Not only are wave physics pretty insane, under water visibility is pretty much 0.  A lot of this will need fixing before I even think about a new Maritime Pack.

I tried making a jet boat with no success. Even launching a single empty fuel tank causes major physics issues, it starts spinning and gets faster and faster until it explodes. Funny to watch. But it seems sea going vessels are a no go right now.
